00015 FileRecorder::FileRecorder( const Settings& s )
00016 {
00017    /* Test the output stream? How do we handle a bad input? */
00018    out_.open(s.output_filename.c_str(), std::ios_base::out|std::ios_base::trunc);
00019    ErrIf( out_.fail() ).info("FileRecorder unable to open: %s\n",s.output_filename.c_str());
00020 }

00027 void FileRecorder::shutdown()
00028 {
00029    out_.close();
00030 }

00038 void FileRecorder::record( const Socket& from, const Socket& to, 
00039                            const char* buf, size_t len )
00040 {
00041    header(from,to);
00042    body(buf, len);
00043 }
00044 
00045 
00046 void FileRecorder::header( const Socket& from, const Socket& to )
00047 {
00048    timespec ts;
00049    clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &ts);
00050    out_ << std::dec << ts.tv_sec << ":" << ts.tv_nsec << "  from: " 
00051         << from.name() << " to: " << to.name() << "\n";
00052 }
00053 
00054 void FileRecorder::body( const char* buf, size_t len )
00055 {
00056    using std::hex;
00057    using std::setw;
00058    using std::setfill;
00059    
00060    // TODO: convert to hex
00061    const unsigned char* p = (const unsigned char*) buf;
00062    size_t at = 0;
00063    while( at < len ) {
00064       out_ << setw(8) << setfill('0') << hex << at;
00065       for( int c=0; at<len && c<8; ++c ) {
00066          out_ << " ";
00067          for( int j=0; at<len && j<2; ++j ) {
00068             out_ << setw(2) << setfill('0') << hex << (int) *p++;
00069             ++at;
00070          }
00071       }
00072       out_ << "\n";
00073    }
00074    out_ << "\n";
00075 }
00076
